Humanarium District, Exhibit Lane 7

I am Mara Bellwether, and yes, I embalm people who are still checking in.

The zoo keeps humans behind tasteful velvet ropes. I run the only funeral home inside the enclosure. On Tuesdays, time runs backward, so we pre-schedule your closure before your opening act. It is legal according to one very tired magistrate.

Services I Can Perform Before You Remember Hiring Me

I offer three arrangement tracks. Pick the one that matches your appetite for chronology failure.

Velvet Goodbye

A traditional service with brass rails, two weeping peacocks, and a respectful zookeeper whistle at minute 11.

$347.99 flat

Includes one complimentary correction if your final words were misheard as "pass the marmalade."

Tuesday Reverse

Paperwork appears before your pulse does. You get your condolence cards on Monday, then spend Tuesday trying to deserve them.

$611.00 + 1 notarized paradox

Most popular with accountants and people who clap when planes land.

Spectral Concierge

A ghost butler named Flinch follows your family for 72 hours, handing out mints and saying, "He planned this."

$47.99/month memorial retainer

Cancel any time, except on Tuesdays, when cancellations arrive last week.

Reversal Gazette

My in-house publication. Printed every Thursday, delivered every Tuesday, understood eventually.

Press Note: New Exhibit Rule About Grieving Volume

The zoo board approved my Quiet Wailing Window (3:10-3:22 PM). Loud sobbing remains available as a premium add-on at $12 per decibel.

Opinion: Why I Ban Beige Coffins

Beige says "office storage". I bury in lacquered coral, star-map blue, or lime with brass rays. Death is not a filing cabinet.

Case Study: The Man Who Attended His Own Tuesday Farewell

Mr. Dent arrived early due to reverse-time slippage, applauded his own eulogy, then asked for edits in track changes. I respected the hustle.

Official Statement from Mara Bellwether

I founded this house after my father died twice in one Tuesday and nobody could decide which bouquet counted. I learned two things: paperwork must be bolder, and grief deserves better lighting.

  • We serve humans currently exhibited, recently departed, or temporally confused.
  • We do not do glitter cannons after the mongoose incident of 2018.
  • We answer urgent calls at (555) 013-REVE.
